product_name: Laura MercierSecret Brightening Color Correcting Longwear Under Eye Setting Powder
summary: SummaryLaura Mercier's Secret Brightening Color Correcting Longwear Under Eye Setting Powder is a lighter-than-air powder color corrects and brightens, while setting and extending concealer wear for an instant eye-awakening effect.
details: DetailsFeaturesBrightens and smooths undereye areaColor corrects discoloration and darknessKeeps concealer fresh all dayKey IngredientsGlycerin & Coconut Derived Emollients- soothes & hydrates skinSilica- soft focus effectMicronized Pigments- prevents settling into fine lines or accentuating shadowsResearch ResultsIn a consumer study with 30 panelist over 4 weeks:97% said it keeps under-eye area looking crease-free94% said it sets and keeps concealer in place91% said it helps keep concealer looking fresh all dayItem 2641189How To UseLa Technique: Set and Brighten the Under EyesLaura's intentional, precision artistry technique that ensures concealer stays in place, with a silky-smooth, imperceptible texture, creating a softly lit, awakened look under the eyes.How to ApplyAfter applying concealer, pick up small amount of Secret Brightening Powder with a small flat brush like Secret Brightening Powder Brush.Tap brush on the back of your hand, working the powder into the bristles.Lightly pat the powder under the eyes to set concealer.Pro-TipLess is more. A sheer amount will set and brighten for all day!IngredientsTalc, Silica, Mica, Dimethicone, Glyceryl Caprylate, Zinc Oxide, P-Anisic Acid, Trimethylsiloxysilicate. +/- (May Contain/Peut Contenir) Carmine (CI 75470), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: La Technique: Set and Brighten the Under EyesLaura's intentional, precision artistry technique that ensures concealer stays in place, with a silky-smooth, imperceptible texture, creating a softly lit, awakened look under the eyes.How to ApplyAfter applying concealer, pick up small amount of Secret Brightening Powder with a small flat brush like Secret Brightening Powder Brush.Tap brush on the back of your hand, working the powder into the bristles.Lightly pat the powder under the eyes to set concealer.Pro-TipLess is more. A sheer amount will set and brighten for all day!

reviews.headline: Powder
reviews.comments: This under the eye setting powder worked well for me for the summer when I have more of a normal skin. It did take a few tries to get right and for me to not use too much. I do wonder if it will dry out my skin under my eyes in the winter when my skin is much drier side.

reviews.headline: Amazingly silky powder
reviews.comments: I saw an influencer use this powder, and I spent a lot of time researching it before I decided to cave and buy it for myself. I always struggle with my concealer and eye makeup creasing and looking greasy by the end of the day. This powder is very fine and goes on so well with a fluffy brush. I only use it around my eyes and they stay smooth all day long. I seem to still get a little oily by the end of the day, but it's definitely not as bad as it was with another brand powder I was using.

reviews.headline: Obsessed!
reviews.comments: The best setting powder I have ever used. Staple in my makeup routine.

reviews.headline: Set it and forget it
reviews.comments: I've tried this powder years ago and for some reason it didn't work for my skin type. I decided to give it another try recently and I'm loving it. I have truly been taking care of my skin lately so this could be the reason why. But it sets my concealer really nice, it doesn't not move my makeup, and it has a good amount of coverage.

reviews.headline: Best setting powder ever
reviews.comments: I love this setting powder. You will look like a walking filter.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I received this product free in exchange for a trial and honest review***

This powder does what it claims to do, and that is setting the concealer, correcting the dark tones, and brightens up the skin of the under eye. It goes on as smooth as a baby's butt! I found that a smaller, flat brush works best, and a little powder goes a long way. Knowing that, this product should last awhile, depending on your typical makeup routine. 
It seems like the small container seals tightly enough that it will not spill when traveling, but I have not tested that probability just yet. 
The only drawback is that this powder only comes in five shades. I feel it's difficult to find the proper shade (just like most other products of this nature) with just a visual look online, so consider using the "test our experts" feature on the website to get free, personalized recommendations. 
The Laura Mercier tinted moisturizers, used in tandem with this Secret Brightening Under Eye Setting powder helps prevent that undesirable flashback that can happen in photos. 
I would recommend this product to those looking for a sure fire way to set that concealer under the eyes, keeping in mind that the proper shade matters!
faceoff_positive.headline: Good product, being mindful of the proper shade

faceoff_negative.comments:
[I was generously given this product for free in exchange for my honest review. My opinion is my own.]

I really wanted to love this product. I have a long history with Laura Mercier. The brand was my first true introduction to the high-end makeup world nearly 20 years ago and Laura Mercier products have never let me down before. However, I'm sad to say this product for me was definitely a miss. 

Don't get me wrong - it's not bad at all, and some things about it were nice. I received the shade Soft Pink to review, and I'm quite pale, so it was a good match. I have dark under eye circles that are a result of genetics and insomnia and even the best concealers can't fully hide them. I was hoping that having this powder on top of my usual concealer would FINALLY do the trick, but no such luck. In terms of color correcting or giving a brighter appearance to my under eye area, sadly this product did nothing at all. I've tried it daily for nearly a week, using different methods of application, different amounts of product, and even different concealers underneath, but it keeps falling flat. 

So what do I like about it, if anything? Well, it does a great job at setting my concealer! Even in this crazy heat wave, it has kept my concealer staying looking as fresh as you could hope for throughout the day, all while avoiding settling into the fine lines under my eyes. However, I would not pay this price for this amount of product just to set my concealer. I might change my mind once I run out and realize how much I miss it, but for now, the search continues for a product that can help brighten my under eye area.
faceoff_negative.headline: A Rare Miss for Mercier
